info.para: In other words, the simultaneous solutions of the given system of linear equations consists of the intersection of the hyperplanes H_1,\dots ,H_n.

statement.para:
Given a system of m linear equations in n unknowns
system of linear equations
solutions discussed in geometrical terms

math.display.latex: \begin{array}{rcccccccccc} (E_1)\qquad & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{11}$}{\color{red} x_1} & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{12}$}{\color{red} x_2} & + & \cdots & \cdots & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{1n}$}{\color{red} x_n} & = & {\color{blue} c_1} \\ (E_2)\qquad & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{21}$}{\color{red} x_1} & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{22}$}{\color{red} x_2} & + & \cdots & \cdots & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{2n}$}{\color{red} x_n} & = & {\color{blue} c_2} \\ \vdots\qquad & \vdots & + & \vdots & + & \ddots & & + & \vdots & & \vdots \\ \vdots\qquad & \vdots & + & \vdots & + & & \ddots & + & \vdots & & \vdots \\ (E_m)\qquad & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{m1}$}{\color{red} x_1} & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{m2}$}{\color{red} x_2} & + & \cdots & \cdots & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$a_{mn}$}{\color{red} x_n} & = & {\color{blue} c_m} \\ \end{array}

statement.para: let H_i denote the hyperplane in \RNr[n] formed by the solutions of the equation E_i. Then the simultaneous solutions of equations E_1,\dots ,E_n consists of all those points in \RNr[n] which belong to each of the hyperplanes H_1,\dots ,H_n.
